definitions: having strong ambitions or hopes for success in achieving something
examples: The aspirant politician campaigned tirelessly for the position
Several aspirant writers submitted their manuscripts to publishers

definitions: directing one's hopes or ambitions toward becoming something specific
examples: The aspiring chef practiced recipes every weekend
An aspiring actor moved to the city for opportunities

definitions: murdered suddenly or secretly, especially for political or ideological reasons
examples: The assassinated leader left behind a divided nation
Several assassinated figures became martyrs for their causes

definitions: declared or stated forcefully and confidently as being true
examples: Her asserted opinions dominated the board meeting discussions
The asserted facts were later verified by independent sources

definitions: having or showing a confident and forceful personality without being aggressive
examples: The assertive manager communicated expectations clearly to staff
Being assertive helped her negotiate a better salary

definitions: given to someone as a task, duty, or designated position
examples: The assigned homework covered three chapters of reading
Each employee worked from their assigned desk location

definitions: taking in and fully understanding information or becoming absorbed into a group
examples: The assimilating immigrants learned the local customs quickly
Her assimilating mind processed complex theories with ease

definitions: helped or supported by someone or something in accomplishing a task
examples: The assisted living facility provided care for elderly residents
Computer assisted design revolutionized the architecture industry completely

definitions: designed to help or assist, especially people with disabilities or special needs
examples: The assistive technology improved accessibility for disabled students
Assistive devices helped the patient regain independence gradually

definitions: characterized by or relating to mental connections between ideas, concepts, or experiences
examples: Her associative thinking linked seemingly unrelated concepts together
The associative memory technique helped students learn vocabulary

definitions: consisting of various kinds mixed together in no particular order
examples: The gift basket contained assorted chocolates and candies
An assorted collection of books filled the library shelves

definitions: accepted as true without proof or taken on without verification
adopted or taken on as one's own, especially regarding identity or role
examples: The assumed connection between events proved to be false
His assumed knowledge led to several critical mistakes
She lived under an assumed name for ten years
The actor maintained his assumed accent throughout filming

definitions: accepting something as true without question or proof beforehand
showing arrogance or presumption in manner or behavior toward others
examples: Assuming good weather, the outdoor wedding will proceed smoothly
The report was written assuming all data was accurate
His assuming attitude alienated potential friends and colleagues
The assuming tone of her voice irritated everyone present

definitions: showing confidence and certainty in oneself or one's abilities
protected or guaranteed to happen or be provided as promised
examples: Her assured performance impressed all the competition judges
He spoke with an assured voice during the presentation
The assured delivery arrived exactly on the promised date
Their assured income provided financial security for retirement

definitions: providing confidence, comfort, or removing doubt through words or actions
examples: The doctor's assuring words calmed the anxious patient
Her assuring smile made everyone feel more relaxed

definitions: suffering from or relating to asthma, causing breathing difficulties
examples: The asthmatic child carried an inhaler at all times
Asthmatic symptoms worsened during the high pollen season

definitions: filled with sudden wonder or amazement at something unexpected
examples: The astonished audience gasped at the magician's final trick
She looked astonished when she won the lottery jackpot

definitions: causing great surprise or amazement through being unexpected or remarkable
examples: The scientist made an astonishing discovery about black holes
Her astonishing talent was evident from an early age

definitions: shocked or greatly surprised to the point of being overwhelmed
examples: The astounded crowd watched the building collapse in seconds
He was astounded by the generosity of complete strangers

definitions: surprisingly impressive or notable to the point of overwhelming amazement
examples: The team achieved astounding results in record breaking time
An astounding number of people attended the free concert

definitions: relating to or resembling the stars or celestial bodies
examples: Ancient civilizations studied astral movements to predict seasons
The astral navigation helped sailors cross vast oceans

definitions: causing the contraction of skin cells and other body tissues
sharp or severe in manner, tone, or taste
examples: The astringent lotion helped tighten pores and reduce oiliness
Witch hazel is a natural astringent used in skincare
His astringent criticism left the students feeling discouraged
The wine had an astringent taste that puckered mouths

definitions: relating to the study of celestial bodies' supposed influence on human affairs
examples: She consulted her astrological chart before making decisions
The astrological predictions appeared in the daily newspaper

definitions: relating to astronomy or the scientific study of celestial objects
extremely large in amount, size, or degree beyond normal comprehension
examples: The astronomical observations required powerful telescopes and patience
Scientists made astronomical calculations to predict the eclipse
The astronomical cost of healthcare worried many American families
The company faced astronomical debt after the failed merger

definitions: having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people
examples: The astute investor recognized the market trend before others
Her astute observations about human behavior impressed colleagues

definitions: having parts that fail to correspond to one another in shape, size, or arrangement
examples: The asymmetric design created visual interest in the building
Asymmetric warfare involves conflicts between unequal military forces

definitions: lacking symmetry or having sides or parts that don't match
examples: Her asymmetrical haircut became a trendy fashion statement
The asymmetrical layout made the room feel more dynamic

definitions: producing or showing no symptoms despite having a disease or condition
examples: Many asymptomatic carriers spread the virus without knowing it
The asymptomatic infection was discovered during routine testing

definitions: not occurring at the same time or operating without a regular time relationship
examples: Asynchronous learning allows students to study at their convenience
The asynchronous communication helped teams across different time zones

definitions: relating to or characterized by disbelief in the existence of deities
examples: The atheist philosopher argued against religious explanations of morality
His atheist views conflicted with his family's religious traditions

definitions: characterized by or showing disbelief or lack of belief in the existence of God
examples: The atheistic worldview relies on scientific explanations for existence
Her atheistic arguments challenged traditional religious teachings effectively

definitions: relating to the earth's atmosphere or the air around us
creating a distinctive emotional tone, mood, or aesthetic feeling
examples: Atmospheric pressure changes can affect weather patterns significantly
The atmospheric conditions made flying dangerous that stormy day
The restaurant's atmospheric lighting created a romantic ambiance
The filmmaker used atmospheric music to build suspense

definitions: relating to atoms or derived from the energy of splitting atoms
extremely small in size or representing the smallest possible unit
examples: Atomic energy powered the submarine for months underwater
The atomic structure of elements determines their chemical properties
The changes happened at an atomic level within cells
Each atomic decision contributed to the project's overall success

definitions: horrifyingly wicked, cruel, or brutal in nature or effect
of extremely poor quality or standard that shocks or appalls
examples: The atrocious war crimes shocked the international community deeply
The dictator's atrocious treatment of prisoners sparked global outrage
The restaurant served atrocious food that customers couldn't eat
His atrocious handwriting made the notes impossible to read

definitions: joined, fastened, or connected to something else physically or functionally
having strong feelings of affection or loyalty toward someone or something
examples: The attached document contains all the required information
A garage was attached to the main house structure
She became deeply attached to her foster family
The attached couple rarely spent any time apart

definitions: launching an aggressive action against someone or something with hostile intent
examples: The attacking army advanced toward the city at dawn
His attacking style of play intimidated opposing team members

definitions: able to be attained, reached, or accomplished with effort
examples: Setting attainable goals helps maintain motivation throughout the process
The scholarship made college education attainable for many students

definitions: succeeded in achieving or reaching something through effort or skill
examples: The attained knowledge proved valuable in her new career
His attained status came after years of dedicated work

definitions: made an effort to achieve or complete something without guaranteed success
examples: The attempted robbery was stopped by alert security guards
Her attempted explanation only confused the situation more

definitions: occurring with or as a result of something else as an accompanying feature
examples: The attendant risks of surgery were explained to patients
Fame brought attendant problems he hadn't anticipated before

definitions: was present at an event, meeting, or gathering as a participant
accompanied or occurring together with something as a related feature
examples: The well attended conference exceeded organizers' expectations completely
She attended every lecture despite her busy work schedule
The attended symptoms suggested a more serious underlying condition
Success was attended by unexpected challenges and new responsibilities

definitions: being present at or participating in an event or activity
occurring along with or as a connected circumstance or result
examples: The attending physician monitored the patient's condition closely
Students attending the workshop received certificates of completion
The attending circumstances made the decision more complicated
All attending factors were considered before reaching a conclusion

definitions: paying close attention to something or thoughtfully caring for someone's needs
examples: The attentive student took detailed notes during every lecture
An attentive waiter anticipated diners' needs before being asked

definitions: declared to be true or genuine, especially formally or officially certified
examples: The attested documents were accepted by immigration officials immediately
Her attested qualifications met all the job requirements perfectly

definitions: dressed in clothes of a specified kind, especially formal or special clothing
examples: The elegantly attired guests arrived at the gala event
Properly attired workers wore safety equipment at all times

definitions: able to be regarded as being caused by or resulting from something
examples: The success was attributable to careful planning and teamwork
Most accidents are attributable to human error rather than mechanical failure

definitions: not representative of a type, group, or class; unusual or uncommon
examples: His atypical behavior worried his friends and family members
The atypical weather patterns disrupted agricultural planning significantly

definitions: of a reddish-brown color, especially describing hair or autumn foliage
examples: Her auburn hair gleamed like copper in the sunlight
The trees displayed beautiful auburn leaves during fall season

definitions: showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks or offend conventions
examples: The audacious plan to climb Everest without oxygen succeeded
Her audacious fashion choices always attracted media attention

definitions: able to be heard clearly enough to be understood or noticed
examples: Her voice was barely audible over the loud music
The audible gasp from the audience showed their surprise
